title: Blended Education Program for Pediatric Physical Therapy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic physical therapy theory and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Blended education conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, emphasizing enhanced pediatric patient response capabilities. While face-to-face practical opportunities may be limited, these are supplemented through simulations and online case analyses.

learning_goals: Explain and apply methods for assessing motor function according to developmental stages in pediatric patients
Accurately perform over 80% of pediatric physical therapy interventions through virtual simulations and online case analyses
Enhance self-efficacy in pediatric patient communication by 20% through collaboration with peers and instructors in a blended learning environment

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
